keel.Algorithms.Rule_Learning.C45Rules

Class Ruleset

  • java.lang.Object
    • keel.Algorithms.Rule_Learning.C45Rules.Ruleset

  • public class Ruleset
extends java.lang.Object

    Representation of a disjuction of rules with a common consecuent. It may be represented as: if (rule1 || rule2) then output=consecuent

    Since:
    JDK1.2

    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Written by Antonio Alejandro Tortosa (University of Granada) 01/07/2008, Modified by Xavi Solé (La Salle, Ramón Llull University - Barcelona) 12/12/2008

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Ruleset()
      Constructs an empty ruleset.

      • addRule

        public void addRule(Rule r)
        Adds a new rule to the ruleset.
        Parameters:

      • apply

        public keel.Algorithms.Rule_Learning.C45Rules.Stats apply(MyDataset data)
        It returns the number of true positives,true negatives,false positives and false negatives of the whole ruleset in a given dataset. This methods takes into account the right part (consecuent) of the rules
        Parameters:
        data - MyDataset the dataset
        Returns:
        number of true positives, false positives, true negatives and false negatives of the whole ruleset in the following order: {tp,tn,fp,fn}

      • apply

        public keel.Algorithms.Rule_Learning.C45Rules.Stats apply(MyDataset data,
                                                          Mask positives,
                                                          Mask negatives)
        It returns the number of true positives,true negatives,false positives and false negatives of the whole ruleset in a given dataset. (This methods doesn't take into account the right part (consecuent) of the rules).
        Parameters:
        data - MyDataset the dataset
        positives - active positive instances of data
        negatives - active negative instances of data
        Returns:
        number of true positives, false positives, true negatives and false negatives of the whole ruleset in the following order: {tp,tn,fp,fn}

      • getExceptionCost

        public double getExceptionCost(MyDataset data,
                               Mask positives,
                               Mask negatives)
        Returns the exception cost for the Minimum Data Length of a dataset given a theory (this ruleset). See [Quinlan95]
        Parameters:
        data - MyDataset the datasets
        positives - Mask active positive entries of data
        negatives - Mask active negative entries of data
        Returns:
        the MDL of data given this ruleset.

      • getExceptionCost

        public double getExceptionCost(MyDataset data,
                               Mask positives,
                               Mask negatives,
                               keel.Algorithms.Rule_Learning.C45Rules.IncrementalMask rulesetMask)
        Returns the exception cost for the Minimum Data Length of a dataset given a theory (this ruleset). See [Quinlan95]
        Parameters:
        data - MyDataset the datasets
        positives - Mask active positive entries of data
        negatives - Mask active negative entries of data
        rulesetMask - the combine mask of all rules in the ruleset.
        Returns:
        the MDL of data given this ruleset.

      • getTheoryCost

        public double getTheoryCost(MyDataset data)
        The description length of the theory for the ruleset. Computed as the addition of the theory cost for each rule:
        0.5* [||k||+ S(t, k, k/t)]
        where k is the number of antecedents of the rule; t is the total possible antecedents that could appear in a rule; ||K|| is the universal prior for k , log2*(k) and S(t,k,p) = -k*log2(p)-(n-k)log2(1-p) is the subset encoding length.

        Parameters:
        data - MyDataset the dataset
        Returns:
        the description length of the theory for the ruleset

      • pulish

        public void pulish(MyDataset data,
                   Mask positives,
                   Mask negatives)
        Remove the rules that increase the DL value of the set.
        Parameters:
        data - the dataset
        positives - the positives exemples
        negatives - the negatives exemples
